jeopardy_round: THE NATIONAL MUSEUM OF HEALTH & MEDICINE

(1, 1).clue: At the museum you can see the spinal column of this 19th century presidential assassin

(3, 1).clue: This presidential candidate proposed the Peace Corps in a 2 A.M. speech to university students

(4, 1).clue: In the early 1900s Wurlitzer built these with special sound effects to be used in movie theaters

(5, 1).clue: This cloth sash is often worn with a tuxedo

(2, 2).clue: John F. Turner's calendars feature puppies, as well as Pamela Anderson & this tennis star

(3, 2).clue: The main job of most education volunteers is teaching this subject

(5, 1).clue: Plain-looking & over 30 were requirements Dorothea Dix had for appointees as these
